result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond D. Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

supervisions.notes: Conditions:  Submit to DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  Pay other costs during term of E.S. but not any earlier (costs not be taken from prison funds).  Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations of treatment.
Court orders revocation to begin immediately.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond D. Hill

records.addlTxt: Judge Sharp has considered the Defendant's request filed 12/17/19 and replies as follows: "The request to shorten the extended supervision is denied. There was a joint recommendation for 3 years in and four years extended supervision. My remark about the minimum mandatory was a reference to the incarceration, not the extended supervision. He was given the minimum amount of incarceration. Further, I cannot change a sentence merely upon reflection. There have to be certain legal grounds met which are not and probably cannot be met here."
Defendant's request "for sentence correction hearing" - asking for amendment of his sentence (forwarded to the Court for review)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Petition and....

(clerk faxed to DOT)
Certificate of ERP Completion and letter request from DOC for change from confinement to e.s. due to ERP completion
of Conviction and Order (for change from confinement to extended supervision due to completion of ERP)
Associated with Charge #1

DA Harper, Def in custody and with Atty. McDougal.  DA states that the parties have reached an agreement whereby the def will be pleading GNC to the sole count in information - OWI 7/8/9 for jt recommendation of bifurcated WI prison sentence with 3 years initial confinement and 4 years ext. supervision; ERP; statutory costs as a condition of e.s.; 3 yrs dl revocation; 2 years IID. 

DA states that this is the first time def has been convicted of a felony so there will need to be a DNA sample and firearms admonishment.  DA states that there were a number of 4ths prior to the law change of 4 within 5 years; notes there was a collateral attack of two prior convictions and the State conceded one of those; Court's ruling was on the remaining collateral attack.  End result, this conviction is def's first felony conviction but it is an OWI 7th.

Counsel have stipulated to 161 days credit.

To charge of OWI 7th, Def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy re plea.  Finding of guilty.  Def addresses the Court.

Sentence:  7 years WI prison system with 3 years i.c. and 4 years e.s.  Dodge as reception center.  ERP eligible and other programs.  Costs only to be imposed $580 total - costs, DNA surcharge, and $62 blood draw restitution;  3 yr revocation;  2 yrs IID upon relicensing.  AODA/follow recommendations of treatment provided.  DNA sample to be provided.  

Felony admonishments provided including firearm admonishment.

161 days credit by stipulation.

Statutory costs to come out of ext. supervision - not out of prison funds.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Appearances by DA Harper, Def in custody, and Atty. McDougal.  DA notes receipt of Court's decision re collateral attack and counsel's review of that decision prior to this hearing; parties are prepared to proceed to plea/sentencing but not today.  This will be def's 7th OWI.  Nov. 7 at 10:30 for plea/sentencing.  PSI not requested or ordered.
Memorandum Decision
Defendant's Brief in Support of Motion to Collaterally Attack Prior Convictions.
State's Response to defendant's collateral attack motion
Oral ruling on October 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Raymond D. Hill in court, in custody with attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State will concede Sturgis conviction, not Vernon county 1991 conviction. Argument. Court requires briefing on this motion. DA requests until the end of the week to submit. Atty M. is given until the 30th to respond. Court will give ruling on October 17, 2014 @ 11:00. Court grants motion in part, making this OWI 7th.
Clerk has notified prosecutor and defense counsel via email that the Aug. 25th 10 a.m. motion hearing is off the calendar due to the #1 case that it was stacked with going to trial (unrelated case)
in support of motion to not count previous OWI convictions for sentene enhancement
to collaterally attack previous convictions
Motion hearing on August 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def in custody on cash bond, and Atty. McDougal.  Information has been filed.  Court states the charges.  Atty. M asks for motion hearing scheduling; plans to file her motion yet this week; 1 hour needed for the hearing.  Court sets Sep. 15 at 3:15.  If one of the late August trials cancel, the Court may be able to do it then.  Atty. M asks that this be tentatively set for the late August dates and, if the trials don't fold, that the Sep. 15 date be used.  Motion hearing scheduled for 08-25-2014 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on September 15, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Arraignment on August 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.

DA Harper, Def in custody and with Atty. McDougal.  Counsel inform the Court that today's hearing will be a waiver.  DA states that an offer has been extended to the defense.  Court conducts prelim waiver colloquy with the def.  Court accepts prelim waiver and binds def over for arraignment.  Arraignment requested and set.  Arraignment scheduled for 08-06-2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's
Preliminary hearing on June 25, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

ADA Forehand appears for the State, RH appears via video/in custody. Atty L McDougal appears in person. Atty M waives reading of complaint. Court reads maximum penalties. Atty M waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Matter is set for prelim hearing on 06/25/2014 at 1:15 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to be in any bar, tavern or establishment whose main purpose is to sell alcohol. Defendant must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.

ADA A Forehand appears for the State, RH appears via video and in custody with Atty L McDougal appearing telephonically. Atty M requests matter be re-set for AIA but requests bail modification. ADA F objects. Court orders cash bond amended to $6000 with same restrictions.  AIA set for 06-10-2014 @ 1:15 p.m.
written minutes
